data.title: Water Polo
data.meta_description: Browse stories related to Water Polo
data.text:
Boomers avoid early Games exit, Stingers earn quarterfinal berth with win over Canada

The Boomers are through to the men's basketball quarterfinals after results go their way, while the Stingers and Gangurrus are assured of advancing from the group stage after their respective wins in the women's water polo and 3x3 basketball.

Topic:Olympic Games

Fri 2 Aug

Photo shows Dyson Daniels of Australia holds his knee after slipping on the court.

How to Silence the Paris Crowd, by the Australian men's water polo team

The Australian men's water polo team is hell-bent on riding a wave of good form all the way to the knockout rounds, after a hard-fought, dramatic 9-8 victory over hosts France and their legions of fans.

Topic:Olympic Games

Thu 1 Aug

Photo shows Nic Porter screams

The Aussie Sharks live up to their pledge to 'shock the world' in Paris

Australia's men's water polo team take down two-time defending Olympic champions Serbia, backing up their mantra to surprise the world.

Topic:Olympic Games

Tue 30 Jul

Photo shows Australian players celebrate with their arms in the air

'I was one of those little girls': How social media keeps Kearns grounded as Stingers go for Olympic gold

Australian water polo star Tilly Kearns has built an impressive following on social media by being authentic. Now she's aiming for an elusive medal with the Stingers at the Paris Olympic Games.

Topic:Olympic Games

Sat 27 Jul

Aussie Sharks 'hungry' as Olympic squad cracks ton two months out from Paris

Australia's mens water polo team will feature 10 new faces at July's Olympic games in Paris, including a new father.

Topic:Water Polo

Tue 28 May

Photo shows Two water polo players pose under a shark at a Sydney Aquarium

'A total disaster': The challenges athletes face when using hormonal contraceptives

Female athletes are more likely to use some form of hormonal contraceptives, but they don't know much about them or the menstrual cycle and it is affecting their performance and health.

Topic:Sport

Wed 28 Feb

Photo shows An Australian female water polo player holds the ball as she prepares to pass against Canada.

Independent review to probe sale of city's precious water to rare earths miner

Rare earths miner Lynas says it has used only a "small proportion" of its greywater allocation from the City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder amid an independent review of contractual arrangements with the council.

Topic:Water Supply

Sun 11 Feb

Photo shows A refinery under construction in bushland which has been cleared.

Melissa Wu endures tough 10m platform final

Melissa Wu, Australia's perennially successful diver, has suffered a rare off day at the World Championships, finishing last in the 10m platform final, as the Sharks are beaten heavily by Croatia.

Topic:Diving

Mon 5 Feb

Photo shows Melissa Wu dives

How Australian water polo looks back to surge forward at World Aquatics Championships and on to Paris 2024

A strong background of supportive legends has Australia's water polo teams ready to surprise the world at World Aquatics Championships.

Topic:Water Polo

Thu 1 Feb

Photo shows Zoe Arancini prepares to shoot

US water polo captain Maggie Steffens blazing trail for stars

She's one of the greatest water polo players the world has ever seen — and American star Maggie Steffens is in Australia, keen to draw more girls to the sport she loves.

Topic:Sport

Tue 10 Jan

Photo shows A woman playing water polo takes a shot at goal by leaping high out of the water.

Australian-first study paves way for mothers returning to elite sport

Some of Australia's top female sportswomen have criticised the lack of support for new mums, prompting the Australia Institution of Sport to investigate.

Topic:Sport

Fri 12 Nov

Photo shows Two female Australian waterpolo players holding one of the athletes' children, smiling for a photo

World swim body seeks to regain trust with a new integrity unit and losing the FINA name

FINA, the governing body of international swimming, is under new management and keen to repair relationships with swimmers, including a new independent integrity unit, more prize money — and potentially changing its name.

Topic:Sport

Mon 11 Oct

Photo shows A TV cameraman stands in front of a blue-coloured big screen with a logo and sign for the world swimming championships.

Is underwater hockey 'the greatest sport that nobody has ever heard of'?

Are you looking to get fit without breaking a sweat? These players say underwater hockey, a cross between water polo and hockey, is the perfect game to play in the tropics.

Topic:Swimming

Tue 7 Sep

Photo shows 12 people swimming towards a hockey puck on the bottom of a pool

'Sport is a fundamental right for all Australians': Transgender athletes welcome inclusion guidelines

Eight peak Australian sporting bodies have unveiled guidelines for the inclusion for transgender people in their sports.

Topic:LGBT

Thu 1 Oct

Photo shows Runner in black shorts and top in a starting crouch on an athletic track.

Australian water polo team 'deeply shocked' after witnessing deadly balcony collapse

Australia's water polo team escapes unharmed when a balcony collapses at a nightclub where the squad is celebrating its bronze medal at the world championships in South Korea.

Topic:Water Polo

Sat 27 Jul

Photo shows A still from a YouTube video showing people trying to hold up a balcony that collapsed at the Coyote Ugly nightclub.

Community support gets injured water polo star to next stage of rehabilitation

Former water polo star Nick Dempsey will leave his Albury home to continue therapy at one of Australia's leading rehabilitation facilities on the Gold Coast.

Topic:Rehabilitation

Sat 15 Jun

Photo shows Nick Dempsey on hospital bed with his mum Trudy

Nick Dempsey plans to be back in Albury mid-year after spinal cord injury

Twenty-one-year-old Nick Dempsey's rehabilitation continues after he severely injured his spinal cord diving into his parents' pool.

Topic:Health

Thu 2 Mar
